item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:5, topic:459583”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=562496.msg4101596#msg4101596 date=1347562481]
First off, farming is going to take you 2 months either way

I’m level 90, and I calculated it out – assuming I do one palm run and 2 magic tree runs daily, it would still take me ~40-45 days to get 99; assuming 1 magic tree is dead each trip (2 per day) and one palm per day.

Note that paying farmers to look after trees actually loses you a lot more money over time than just letting some die. Also, if you have remote farm and are on say, once an hour, you can prevent most trees from dying anyways by curing them remotely.
[/quote]I plan to buy the farmers protection so more like maybe a month and a half?[/quote]Buying farmer protection gives you about 12.5% more xp over time, so you’d probably be saving a week at most

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

I can’t remember how fast this is, but making wines costs about 900gp per 200xp. So think about doing that.

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Ice barrage to 99 is roughly 10gp an xp if you prep for it properly by using things like void etc (+ good charms if you do rock lobs/or very afk if skeles).
Combat is only expensive/hard if you do it wrong or expect unreasonable results.

If your really wanting farm up fast, do best trees etc + livid farm. Of the top of my head it’d take you about 250hrs depending on how much you play (the less you play the more farm runs = less hours but slower overall progress). Ofc it could take more than that, I just estimated farm runs and not 100% dedication to farming:).

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Cooking at the rogue’s den is the fastest in my opinion. Using cooking gauntlets makes it super fast to get xp there.

Rogue’s den is a good option if you don’t have access to the cooking guild bank. Cooking guild bank is the shortest path between a bank and a range in the game.

Edit: also, a range is much better for cooking than a fire.

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:6, topic:459578”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=562496.msg4101454#msg4101454 date=1347548277]
Cooking is ridiculously fast if you use the range in the cooking guild. You can basically get 90-99 in 2-3 days there. Be sure to use cooking gauntlets and decorated urns!
[/quote]

I thought bonfires + urns were quicker as they give bonus XP?[/quote]

I got 99 cooking before bonfires came out, so I can’t really comment. It’s about the same walking distance. Being secluded at the cooking guild has its benefits, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Nvm
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

First off, farming is going to take you 2 months either way

I’m level 90, and I calculated it out – assuming I do one palm run and 2 magic tree runs daily, it would still take me ~40-45 days to get 99; assuming 1 magic tree is dead each trip (2 per day) and one palm per day.

Note that paying farmers to look after trees actually loses you a lot more money over time than just letting some die. Also, if you have remote farm and are on say, once an hour, you can prevent most trees from dying anyways by curing them remotely.
